Test: coverage

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-03-22

Source: vignettes/tests/test.Rmd
test.Rmd

See tests in semmcci_notes 

library(testthat)
library(semmcci)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'semmcci'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     print
library(lavaan)
#> This is lavaan 0.6-8
#> lavaan is FREE software! Please report any bugs.

With Defined Parameters

# Generate Data ------------------------------------------------------------
n <- 1000
x <- rnorm(n = n)
m <- 0.50 * x + rnorm(n = n)
y <- 0.25 * x + 0.50 * m + rnorm(n = n)
data <- data.frame(x, m, y)

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
  ab := a * b
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model,
  fixed.x = FALSE
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2290 0.0367 100  0.1221 0.1285 0.1463  0.2900  0.3048   0.3137
#> b    0.5440 0.0331 100  0.4712 0.4776 0.4932  0.6198  0.6328   0.6352
#> a    0.5216 0.0292 100  0.4502 0.4579 0.4719  0.5792  0.5920   0.5981
#> y~~y 1.0228 0.0440 100  0.9262 0.9267 0.9356  1.0944  1.1212   1.1314
#> m~~m 0.9353 0.0384 100  0.8392 0.8502 0.8677  1.0125  1.0597   1.0974
#> x~~x 1.0019 0.0411 100  0.9147 0.9184 0.9311  1.0879  1.1103   1.1159
#> ab   0.2837 0.0224 100  0.2416 0.2420 0.2463  0.3347  0.3445   0.3457

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.1834 0.0294 100  0.0978 0.1029 0.1171  0.2322  0.2440   0.2512
#> b    0.4782 0.0291 100  0.4143 0.4199 0.4336  0.5448  0.5563   0.5584
#> a    0.4751 0.0266 100  0.4100 0.4170 0.4298  0.5275  0.5392   0.5447
#> y~~y 0.6544 0.0282 100  0.5926 0.5929 0.5986  0.7002  0.7173   0.7239
#> m~~m 0.7743 0.0318 100  0.6947 0.7038 0.7183  0.8382  0.8773   0.9085
#> x~~x 1.0000 0.0410 100  0.9129 0.9166 0.9293  1.0858  1.1081   1.1137
#> ab   0.2272 0.0179 100  0.1935 0.1938 0.1972  0.2680  0.2758   0.2768

Without Defined Parameters

# Fit Model in lavaan ------------------------------------------------------
model <- "
  y ~ cp * x + b * m
  m ~ a * x
"
fit <- sem(
  data = data,
  model = model
)

# Monte Carlo --------------------------------------------------------------
mc <- mc(
  fit,
  R = 100L, # use a large value e.g., 20000L for actual research
  alpha = c(0.001, 0.01, 0.05)
)
semmcci::print(mc)
#> Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.2290 0.0372 100  0.1362 0.1451 0.1584  0.2876  0.3139   0.3164
#> b    0.5440 0.0356 100  0.4561 0.4563 0.4727  0.6095  0.6145   0.6159
#> a    0.5216 0.0323 100  0.4402 0.4426 0.4606  0.5773  0.5959   0.6060
#> y~~y 1.0228 0.0476 100  0.9024 0.9044 0.9156  1.0940  1.1535   1.1671
#> m~~m 0.9353 0.0383 100  0.8487 0.8511 0.8576  1.0052  1.0137   1.0168
#> x~~x 1.0019     NA  NA      NA     NA     NA      NA      NA       NA

# Standardized Monte Carlo -------------------------------------------------
std <- std(mc)
semmcci::print(std)
#> Standardized Monte Carlo Confidence Intervals
#>         est     se   R ci_0.05 ci_0.5 ci_2.5 ci_97.5 ci_99.5 ci_99.95
#> cp   0.1834 0.0298 100  0.1090 0.1161 0.1268  0.2303  0.2514   0.2534
#> b    0.4782 0.0313 100  0.4010 0.4011 0.4155  0.5359  0.5402   0.5415
#> a    0.4751 0.0294 100  0.4009 0.4031 0.4194  0.5258  0.5428   0.5519
#> y~~y 0.6544 0.0304 100  0.5774 0.5786 0.5858  0.7000  0.7380   0.7467
#> m~~m 0.7743 0.0317 100  0.7026 0.7046 0.7100  0.8322  0.8392   0.8418
#> x~~x 1.0000     NA  NA      NA     NA     NA      NA      NA       NA
test_that("TRUE", {
  expect_true(
    TRUE
  )
})
#> Test passed ðŸ˜€
